captions.text: I need details Captain. Tell me everything about him.
I'm in a lot of pain...
Ngghh...We.. We thought we had him him trapped, but he was waiting for us...
...you knew we couldn't take him down.
You knew we were no match for him.
Yes, but soon we will be. This is merely one more twist of the knife to test him.
Because I know everything about you. Your darkest secret. Your ultimate weakness. I know you are Bruce Wayne.

comments.text: This game dethroned Metal Gear Solid as my all time favorite game.﻿
comments.author: Chris C

comments.text:
Why didn't they make the game with these graphics?
I mean, it's not that it's bad how it looks, but this looks as good as 
Arkham Knight.﻿
comments.author: AndSalx

comments.text:
Battlefield is a first person shooter with smaller scaled maps and scripted 
destruction. Open world games take a lot more effort to put into since 
people tend to notice the details. For example, the Gotham and Arkham in 
the videogames are much better than the ones in the movies because they 
ooze with style, whereas Nolan's movies were meant to look more realistic 
and less comic-book like, so he settled for regular buildings. You can't 
really compare two different genres in that regard.
comments.author: MizuDG

comments.text:
Yeah, you're right. Don't forget Battlefield 3 which looks awesome even 
today. It was possible, but not as frequent as it is today.
comments.author: AndSalx

comments.text:
+AndSalx Because this was 5 years ago? And it's CG? Engine and graphical 
limitations still applied 5 years ago and it was definitely going to be 
dumbed down for 360 and PS3 even if it was possible to achieve Arkham 
Knight graphics back then. (example Watch_Dogs)

+averythesuperhero Not hard to figure, Batman has hi-tech stuff so he has 
to be rich, most likely a loner and single to keep his secret and a 
motavation for fighting crime like being a victim of it. Bruce Wayne meets 
all of those requirements. True he isn't the only super rich guy in or 
around Gotham but a lot of them who experienced crime first hand like Zasze 
turn into villains themselves more often than not.

comments.author: youngstermr

comments.text:
MY hope is that if Deathstroke keeps increasing in popularity (which seems 
very likely, as long as they handle his character decently in the new game, 
plus you get to play as him) that he will become one of the 2-4 "main" 
villains in the next game, the guy orchestrating it all. Google 
Deathstroke's powerset if you don't know it, if there is anyone who can 
truly take out Batman, outfight him, and out-think him (his greatest asset, 
after all), it's Slade Wilson. Deadpool/Joker are close 2nd, tho.
comments.author: Joe Cannabyte

comments.text:
I was let down with the DLC expansion to a degree, mainly because they made 
the one guy in the DCU who can out Batman the Batman (Deathstroke) such a 
fucking punk. Even at 55-65 which is the approx. age he is at (Given that 
he is 45 and white-haired in the upcoming prequel) he is essentially a dash 
of Deadpool/Wolverine (healing factor) with Captain America's strength and 
speed and the Punisher's tactical and strategic brilliance. He also took on 
the entire JLA before and punked B-man twice.
comments.author: Joe Cannabyte

comments.text:
I was delighted to see Joker turn the tables on EVERYONE, get potential 
access to immortality and then DIE. I don't see how the stakes could have 
been raised any further except if they did (And I'm surprised we haven't 
seen this, yet) the Poison Ivy kryptonite lipstick/spore shit and get a 
mind-controlled (yet inner-battling) Superman chasing after Batman in the 
end. The wholesale destruction a Superman even at 45% would've been insane. 
But Protocol 10, Joker dying, Batman almost dying, etc.-
comments.author: Joe Cannabyte

comments.text:
It's actually quite a bit similar to "Batman: Prey" (where they 
re-introduced Hugo Strange for the first time after the first Crisis). 
Strange is also supposed to be trained to a physical and mental peak, etc. 
We didn't see much of that, Ras was pulling the strings all along (which 
I'm fine with to a degree, he is the first man, not Strange, to deduce 
Batman's identity). Though I'm of the opposite, while I was kinda expecting 
the same "Strange=Power Perceived" storyline that was in prey-
comments.author: Joe Cannabyte

comments.text:

spans of a dog.

comments.text:
That was a bit of a let-down, I love the game, but you're right. They

comments.text:
I can't help but feel a bit let down, I love the game don't get me wrong, 
but they built up so much hype around hugo strange and the fact that he 
knows batman's identity, but they did NOTHING about it in the actual game. 
Strange tells you he knows your secret but he doesn't do anything with it, 
he lets Wayne off the hook, makes a bunch of empty threats as he plows 
through the tyger force and is ultimately powerless to stop batman from 
wrecking his shit, very piss poor villain.
comments.author: fwwaller
